meanings.definition: To come into contact with something while moving.
meanings.sent1: The boy was bumping into the furniture as he ran around the room.
meanings.sent2: The car was bumping along the bumpy road.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept bumping into walls while chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The music was so loud that it felt like it was bumping against my chest.
meanings.sent5: The waves were bumping against the shore, creating a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: To move or shake with a jolt.
meanings.sent1: She was bumping the table accidentally while dancing.
meanings.sent2: The train was bumping as it traveled over the tracks.
meanings.sent3: The clown was bumping around the circus tent, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The earthquake made the ground feel like it was bumping beneath our feet.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind was bumping the tree branches against the window.

meanings.sent1: The bumping of the two cars caused a small dent.
meanings.sent2: I heard a bumping sound coming from the attic.
meanings.sent3: The bumping of the basketball against the hoop echoed in the gym.
meanings.sent4: The bumping of the doors closing could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent5: The bumping of the luggage being loaded onto the plane signaled the start of the trip.
